image.altText: A composite image of two men, whose faces are slightly in shadow. They are each looking to the side with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: Military lawyer David McBride gave journalist Dan Oakes more than a hundred classified military documents. Both are still living with the consequences.

title.children: Six years after the journalist and whistleblower last spoke they're still grappling with the fallout

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a suit with a red tie raises his hand while standing in front of a United States flag.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump owes an enormous sum of money to the state of New York and he is running out of time to hand it over. This is what we know about the case against Trump and his battle to pay his big bill.

title.children: The former US president and Republican nominee needs to find $712m by tonight. Here’s what happens if he fails

image.altText: Person holding out a credit card card against their laptop

props.synopsis: Inflation isn't just hitting households, it's also affecting scammers with the price of stolen documents like passports and driver's licences skyrocketing on the dark web.

title.children: Andy's scammers weren't satisfied with ripping him off once. They kept calling to try and get more money from him

image.altText: A man looks at a woman with dark hair

props.synopsis: After his office initially failed to execute a viable PR plan to protect his family, Prince William may now have time and space to focus on his wife's health and the wellbeing of his children. But the heir to the British throne has a rocky road ahead.

title.children: William's nightmare 2024 has taught him the toughest lesson monarchs learn about their subjects' love

image.altText: A woman and a man standing behind some trees.

props.synopsis: A student-led report that surveyed more than 800 people studying at one of Australia's most prestigious universities has found more than two thirds have either experienced or witnessed causal racism.

title.children: 'They think you're calling them racist': Student survey shines light on one of Australia's top universities

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks to the press club in a stern, close-up shot

props.synopsis: A fierce battle over housing is set to define the next federal election as Labor, the Coalition and the Greens target a growing cohort of voters who believe they've been locked out of home ownership for life.

title.children: A housing crisis freight train is coming — and one question must be answered by the government and Coalition

image.altText: Equality Australia Legal Director Ghassan Kassisieh speaking to media

props.synopsis: An Equality Australia report says students in religious schools are more likely to be discriminated against, as the federal government considers new laws on the subject.

title.children: New report finds discrimination endemic in religious schools as government considers legislation

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: LGBT+ people and advocates call for progress on religious discrimination debate
Government makes late tweaks to gas changes in effort to ease concerns
Equality Australia says religious discrimination is 'endemic'

image.altText: A man is pictured from the left side profile, his face bruised. On the right side of his head a bandage.

props.synopsis: Four suspects have been charged with acts of terrorism in connection to the shooting at Crocus City Hall, where at least 137 people were killed on Friday.

title.children: First charges laid following Moscow concert hall attack as Russia mourns 137 victims

image.altText: A cream French bulldog is licking her lips while looking up at a bowl of food.

props.synopsis: Pet food is a multi-billion-dollar global industry, yet in Australia it's still widely unregulated. Animals and their owners are paying the ultimate price.

title.children: What exactly is in your pet's food? Here's why some experts are very worried

image.altText: A black and white image of a father's and mother's hands and a baby's tiny foot.

props.synopsis: Pregnancy loss, stillbirth and infant death affect thousands of Australian families every year, yet it's often not talked about. In a bid to change that, parents are speaking about their heartbreak on national Say Their Name Day.

title.children: Parents speak about the loss that will never go away, and the importance of remembering

image.altText: Kitchen worker uses tongs in a pub kitchen in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The government will advocate that the wages of Australia's lowest-paid workers do not go backwards, as the Fair Work Commission reviews minimum and award wage rates.

title.children: Government pushes for minimum wage increase to keep pace with inflation

image.altText: A man wearing a long-sleeved blue shirt and red braces stands, looking out of a bunker.

props.synopsis: David Aitken's experience of surviving the Black Summer bushfires led him to install a 7-tonne concrete bunker in his backyard. It's currently his wine cellar and, he hopes, never anything more.

title.children: David is one of a growing number of Australians installing a bunker, but he's not a doomsday prepper

image.altText: A space with computers and desks is pictured with students working.

props.synopsis: Education Minister Jason Clare will today announce $16 million to fund 10 new study hubs in Victoria, Western Australia, Queensland, South Australia and Tasmania to better support students who live far from campus.

title.children: Five states to get new study hubs to lift university enrolment in regions

image.altText: A woman wearing a headscarf waters plants in a small courtyard. She is smiling.

props.synopsis: Lack of data about the impact of cancer treatments on fertility and ovarian function is an "enormous oversight" and a "disservice to women," experts say.

title.children: Pamela wants to know if immunotherapy will affect her fertility — but doctors don't have an answer

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australian shares lift during the first session of the week following Wall Street traders taking a breather on Friday in the wake of a massive run-up in values. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX surges past 7,800 after US markets wrap up their best week this year, ANZ settles credit card class action

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX edges past 7,800 as miners gain on higher iron ore prices
Inquiry into The Star to be held in public
ANZ to pay $57.5m to settle credit card class action

image.altText: View of smoke and flames from the bushfire still burning in WA.

props.synopsis: The Department of Fire and Emergency Services says two residences have been lost to the bushfire burning south of Perth.

title.children: Two buildings lost as WA fire fight enters third day

image.altText: Composite image of three West Australian Sheffield Shield teams with the trophy.

props.synopsis: Graeme Wood's teams won three straight titles in the late 1980s, and player of the final Sam Whiteman says his Sheffield Shield squad deserves similar standing after their treble.

title.children: 'One of the great WA teams': Third straight Sheffield Shield crown puts Whiteman's Warriors in rare air

image.altText: A young woman wearing a red gingham dress sits on a bench beside her mum. They have their arms around each other and smile.

props.synopsis: My body has always been there to catch me. It took an ACL injury to appreciate it.

title.children: What an ACL injury taught me about patience and appreciating my body

image.altText: China

props.synopsis: As China considers changes to the rights of workers there are concerns about the impact on businesses and how the solutions would be implemented.

title.children: What is 'invisible' overtime and why is China concerned about it?

image.altText: An image shows a man behind the wheel of a car, a woman in a gold dress smiling at camera, and a man holding a coffee.

props.synopsis: Accessibility isn't just about being able to get on a bus or use a public toilet. Queer people with disability say they often feel like they're being "marginalised even on the margins".

title.children: Living with disability and being queer poses a 'double whammy' of accessibility challenges

image.altText: building made from snow

props.synopsis: When a 15-metre-high snow sculpture took centre stage at a snow festival in Japan, it helped form a surprisingly powerful relationship between two islands — Hokkaido and Tasmania.

title.children: In the 1980s, Tasmania's Government House was sculpted in snow in Japan. Here's why

image.altText: A woman looks out of a hotel window

props.synopsis: Four years after Australia's hotel quarantine system was enacted to slow the spread of COVID-19, states and territories are still struggling to recoup the money they spent establishing and managing the scheme.

title.children: Governments still chasing millions from people who stayed in Australia's quarantine hotels

image.altText: Aid falls to the ground attached to parachutes in the distance as a group of people sit on rocks looking on

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent says one of its staff members and another displaced Gazan have been killed during fighting at the facilities.

title.children: Two people killed as hospitals besieged in Gaza, Palestinian aid agency told deliveries will not be approved

image.altText: George Russell's Mercedes car on its side after a crash in the Australian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: Fernando Alonso is relegated to eighth in the Australian Grand Prix, after a 20-second penalty was handed to him post race for dangerous driving that caused George Russell to crash out.

title.children: Fernando Alonso handed Aus GP penalty for 'extraordinary' driving, causing George Russell's crash

image.altText: A red ferrari drives through a street lined with crowds of formula one fans.

props.synopsis: Cries of "forza Ferrari" were heard across Melbourne's "Little Italy" as celebrations of Ferrari's win in the Australian Formula 1 Grand Prix continued late into the night.

title.children: Track ban re-think as F1 fans praised for behaviour over Australian grand prix weekend

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff walks through a crowded room and cameras film him.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Liberals might have spent the weekend looking at the result of the election for a newly expanded parliament and wondering what exactly was the point, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: Rockliff thought expanding Tasmania's parliament would make life easier. The electorate had other ideas

image.altText: new south wales premier wearing a suit and tie looks at the camera at a health announcement at RPA Sydney

props.synopsis: One year into Chris Minns's leadership, we track the progress of Labor's key election policies.

title.children: The election promises kept — and broken — after one year of Minns government in NSW

image.altText: two goats

props.synopsis: An academic-turned-farmer who stopped a flock of Angora goats from going to the slaughterhouse hopes to use genetic breeding to extend the number of years they can produce high-quality fleece.

title.children: Goats destined for meat market now supplying Australian mohair to Italian fashion houses

image.altText: rescue team carry a body bag from the sea.

props.synopsis: The bodies of three Rohingya refugees have been found in the sea as Indonesian authorities ended a search for survivors from a boat that capsized near Aceh province.

title.children: Three bodies found at sea after Rohingya boat capsizes off Indonesia's Aceh province

image.altText: A young woman at a festival wearing a brightly-coloured clothes.

props.synopsis: Volunteering, recycling and education are just some of the ways music-loving young people are working to reduce the shocking amount of waste generated at music festivals.

title.children: Culture of abandoned camping gear at music festivals sparks young Aussies to lead recycling efforts

image.altText: A bald man with glasses holds his arms up as he races other waiters.

props.synopsis: The famous, or infamous, wait staff of Paris are put to the ultimate test of speed and poise in a 2-kilometre circuit through the Olympic city's streets.

title.children: More than 100 years after the first and 13 years after the last, the most French race in the world returns to Paris
